info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 6:32PM CDT until June 22 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WASHITA...NORTHWESTERN CADDO...SOUTHEASTERN CUSTER AND SOUTHWESTERN BLAINE COUNTIES... At 632 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Thomas to 3 miles southeast of Hydro to 3 miles west of Eakly, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Hydro, Corn, Custer City, Eakly, Colony, and Fort Cobb Reservoir. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
